publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4242 Bill Kidd: International-class ReDevelopment of Glasgow School of Art Garnethill Site—That the Parliament commends Glasgow School of Art (GSA), under the leadership of Seona Reid, for having concluded stage one of the international search to find an architect-led team to design and deliver phase one of the Garnethill site, located opposite the renowned Mackintosh building; notes the level of interest that the reDevelopment project has attracted with 153 entries from across the world, including the United States of am erica, Japan, Australia, Spain, Finland, Denmark and the Netherlands, which has resulted in an impressive shortlist of architecture team s having been compiled, and believes that any one of the architect team s shortlisted, with the final decision being made by the selection committee in September of this year, will deliver a building that will provide the GSA with world-class facilities for teaching and research, support the aspirations of GSA for growth and build on the international reputation of the school, while enhancing the setting for the Mackintosh building and Garnethill. Supported by : Rob Gibson*, Jam ie Hepburn*
S3M-4242 International-class Redevelopment of Glasgow School of Art Garnethill Site (lodged on 26 May 2009) Des McNulty*, Robin Harper*, Kenneth Gibson*, Gil Paterson*, Bob Doris*
S3M-4242 International-class Redevelopment of Glasgow School of Art Garnethill Site (lodged on 26 May 2009) Bill Aitken*

S3M-4242 Bill Kidd: International-class Redevelopment of Glasgow School of Art Garnethill Site—That the Parliament commends Glasgow School of Art (GSA), under the leadership of Seona Reid, for having concluded stage one of the international search to find an architect-led team to design and deliver phase one of the Garnethill site, located opposite the renowned Mackintosh building; notes the level of interest that the redevelopment project has attracted, with 153 entries from across the world, including the United States of America, Japan, Australia, Spain, Finland, Denmark and the Netherlands, which has resulted in an impressive shortlist of architecture teams having been compiled, and believes that any one of the architect teams shortlisted, with the final decision being made by the selection committee in September 2009, will deliver a building that will provide the GSA with world-class facilities for teaching and research, support the aspirations of GSA for growth and build on the international reputation of the school, while enhancing the setting of the Mackintosh building and Garnethill. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Jamie Hepburn, Des McNulty, Robin Harper, Kenneth Gibson, Gil Paterson, Bob Doris, Bill Aitken
S3M-4242 International-class Redevelopment of Glasgow School of Art Garnethill Site (lodged on 26 May 2009) Stuart McMillan*
